Type material examined.
Paratypes : ♂ ( KMNH ), “( Taiwan ) / Sungkang / Nantou Hsien [w, p] //
9 .VI.
[h] 1965 / T. Shirôzu [w, p] // Exosoma / taiwanum / Kimoto, n. sp. [w, h] // PARATYPE [b, p]”; ♂ ( KMNH ), “( Taiwan ) / Fenchihu, 1400m / Chiayi Hsien [w, p] //
10 .IV.
[h] 1965 / T. Shirôzu [w, p] // Japan – U.S. / Co–op. Sci. / Programme [y, p] // PARATOPOTYPE [b, p] // Exosoma / taiwanum / Kimoto, n. sp. [w, h]”.

Redescription . Measurements. Males: 4.5–5.4 mm , females: 4.6–5.7 mm . Dorsal side lustrous, glabrous, oval, convex. Body, legs and antennae completely metallic bluish-black, except mouthparts dark brown and abdomen yellow.

Male (
Fig. 84
). Anterior part of head impunctate glabrous. Interantennal space 1.2 times as wide as transverse diameter of antennal socket. Interocular space 1.65 times as wide as transverse diameter of eye. Antennae filiform, 0.8 times as long as body, length ratio of antennomeres equals
12 - 6 - 6-16
- 15 - 15 - 15-16 - 17 - 16-21 .

Pronotum lustrous, 1.25 times as broad as long, widest in anterior third, covered with fine punctures, punctures in the middle of disc almost indistinct. Anterior margin straight, lateral margins rounded, posterior margin widely rounded. Anterior margin very finely bordered, lateral margins with broad border, posterior margin moderately bordered. Anterior angles swollen with setigerous pore in posterior half of swelling, posterior angles with small pointed tip with setigerous pore, all pores bearing long pale seta, additional short setae visible on lateral margins of pronotum.
Elytra 1.8 times as long as wide and 0.75–0.78 times as long as body.

Length ratio of protarsomeres I, II, III and V equals
10 - 7 - 5-10
, of metatarsomeres I, II, III and V equals
15 - 8 - 6-12 .

Biology. Some specimens were collected on the flowers of
Acer serrulatum Hayata
( Aceraceae ) and
Eriobotrya deflexa (Hemsl.) Nakai
f.
deflexa (Hemsl.) Nakai
( Rosaceae ).

Differential diagnosis.
Charaea taiwanum
is a large Taiwanese species ( 4.5–5.7 mm ) similar to
Ch. maxbarclayi
sp. nov.
,
Ch. mimicum
and
Ch. kelloggi
. Both
Charaea mimicum
and
Ch. kelloggi
differ in possessing pronotal punctuation with fine small and large punctures and lateral pronotal margins with wide borders. The pronotum of
Ch. taiwanum
is only finely punctate and the lateral pronotal margins are moderately wide.
Charaea taiwanum
shares with
Ch. maxbarclayi
sp. nov.
a visible prosternal process between the procoxae but male antennomere IV is 2.5 times as long as II and III combined (only twice in
Ch. maxbarclayi
sp. nov.
). Species also can be distinguished also by the structure of the aedeagus ( Figs 5 , 11 ,
76 , 113
).
